We're back in the office! ğŸ‰ After a well needed summer break full of relaxation and reflection, our team is now fully back in the office and ready to help fulfil all your #DEI needs. ğŸ«±ğŸ»ğŸ«²ğŸ¿ You can check out our full range of corporate solutions here: https://lnkd.in/d8zk5sf Or reach out to hello@wecreatespace.co to request a sales brochure! ğŸ’Œ #DEISolutions #CultureChange

Get to know our 2024 WCS #LGBTQ+ Awards Winners! ğŸ†ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ This year's WCS | Awards are celebrating Queer Leaders across Spain - LGBTQ+ change-makers who are using their platforms, profile and roles to drive change, making the world a more inclusive place for all LGBTQ+ people. ğŸŒ Lidiane Castro is a lecturer with a Doctorate in Audiovisual Communication and Advertising, specialising in Communication and Gender Studies. Lidiane teaches business, marketing, and communication at both bachelor's and master's levels with a commitment to student-centred learning. Her academic journey including research, curriculum development, and numerous publications and conference presentations has a significant and evolving impact in the field. As Co-organiser and Cultural Director of International Lesbians Barcelona (ILB), Lidiane has harnessed her academic expertise to shape community initiatives that celebrate LGBTQ+ culture and foster a sense of belonging. She organises events, conducts educational workshops, and creates support networks aimed at promoting inclusivity and understanding. âœ¨ Learn about our other 2024 award winners: https://lnkd.in/ehUG6gAP #LGBTLeaders #InclusionMatters

What do you think a â€˜leaderâ€™ looks like? ğŸ’­ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ We often expect leaders to look or act a certain way, but people of all identities and backgrounds are capable of bringing powerful leadership qualities to the table - so how do we challenge these biases? ğŸ” In this new article, guest writer Sayantani Chakravarty shares insights from her PhD in Management, examining how rigid ideas around gender hold back LGBTQIA+ people in the workplace and impact their ability to thrive as leaders. Thank you to Nancy Di Dia and MK Getler-Porizkova for sharing additional insights from their lived experience for this piece! ğŸ’š ğŸ“– Check out the full article: https://lnkd.in/ebhzfzuN #DiverseLeadership #DEI

Get to know our 2024 WCS #LGBTQ+ Awards Winners! ğŸ†ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ This year's WCS | Awards are celebrating Queer Leaders across Spain - LGBTQ+ change-makers who are using their platforms, profile and roles to drive change, making the world a more inclusive place for all LGBTQ+ people. ğŸŒ RubÃ©n AntÃ³n is queer artist and researcher of newspaper archives. They have been called "the first archaeologist of Iberian crossdressers and travesti". Through their work and historical memory project 'Drag is Burning', Ruben recovers the historia del travestismo (history of cross dressing) in Spain, from the 15th century until now, with a unique historical journey through more than five centuries of silenced and forgotten characters. With over 100 art exhibitions and over 50 podcast shows made since 2020, Ruben has visited venues ranging from Barcelona to Dubai. Currently, in addition to working on their collections, Ruben collaborates with betevÃ©, Barcelona's public television, on its queer culture section and actively participates in LGBTQ+ festivals, talks and projects. âœ¨ Learn about our other 2024 award winners: https://lnkd.in/ehUG6gAP #LGBTLeaders #InclusionMatters

Lessons learned from creating spaces for #LGBTQIA+ Women. ğŸ‘‡ğŸ¼ WCS Community Director Sevi K. ğŸ³ğŸŒˆ writes about the importance of creating intersectional, intergenerational spaces for LGBTQIA+ women, informed by her experiences creating and hosting We Create Space's Queer Women in Business Meet Ups. ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ These spaces offer LGBTQIA+ women a chance to come together and connect over their experiences, sharing wisdom and community knowledge so they can all be better advocates for each other. Thanks to Yassine Senghor (She/Her), Cindy Nehme and Sanjukta Moorthy (Sun-yook-ta) for also sharing their thoughts in this piece. ğŸ’š ğŸ”— Read the full article: https://lnkd.in/ehzXSbmH #WomenInBusiness #DEI

Get to know our 2024 WCS #LGBTQ+ Awards Winners! ğŸ†ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ This year's WCS | Awards are celebrating Queer Leaders across Spain - LGBTQ+ change-makers who are using their platforms, profile and roles to drive change, making the world a more inclusive place for all LGBTQ+ people. ğŸŒ Alberto AntÃ³n BenÃ­tez is an advertising professional and volunteer dedicating his time over the last few years to a wide range of LGBTQ+ initiatives and efforts in Barcelona. Alberto is driven by the idea that the happiness and growth of the community is rooted in the establishment of a solid and healthy social fabric. âœ¨ Learn about our other 2024 award winners: https://lnkd.in/ehUG6gAP #LGBTLeaders #InclusionMatters

Experiencing Queerness Across the Globe ğŸŒğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ When we travel somewhere, we canâ€™t just leave our identities behind, and often they can grow and evolve as a part of our journeys. But what would it be like to uproot yourself for an entire year and live on the road, carrying your queerness as you went? ğŸ’ In this new article Luke Lopez reflects on the highs and lows of his year travelling the globe as a Queer digital nomad, from navigating homophobia to moments of self-actualisation and dismantling self-limiting beliefs. ğŸŒ± ğŸ”— Read the full article: https://lnkd.in/eD7BvBRx #DigitalNomad #LGBTQ

Combating Trans Misinformation ğŸ³ï¸âš§ï¸ We had the pleasure of delivering a panel discussion on this new topic for Experian during Pride Month this year and were heartened by the overwhelming positive feedback! â¤ï¸ In an era where trans rights are viciously under attack, it's becoming more and more important to equip ourselves and the people around us with the tools to identify and challenge misinformation about trans people - knowledge is power! âœŠğŸ¼ Thanks to our amazing speakers Rico Jacob Chace, Taylor Lianne Chandler Walker, Doug A. Graffeo, ilÄ Kamalagharan and Sabah Choudrey for making this discussion so impactful! â€œI loved seeing other trans and intersex people discussing the struggles trans people in general face but also the hopeful messages. I felt a sense of community and also have some cool resources to check out. My take away is that I need to find queer community.â€ - Participant feedback ğŸ’¬ We're eager to do more of these sessions, so if you'd like to bring it to your organisation get in touch at hello@wecreatespace.co ğŸ’Œ ğŸ§‘ğŸ½ğŸ’» Check out ten more trans training programme suggestions: https://lnkd.in/ef82uUS4 #DEI #TransRights
